content.rendered:
What is a Library Technician?

Library Technicians assist Librarians with general tasks like helping patrons and organizing library materials. Their duties are similar to Clerical Library Assistants.

Where does a Library Technician work?

  • University or school
  • Museum
  • Public library

How much does a Library Technician make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Library Technician is $37,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Library Technicians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Library science majors
  • English majors
  • Philosophy majors
Search Library Technician jobs on Handshake

Library Technician skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Library Technicians succeed in their work:

  • Customer service and general interpersonal skills
  • Great organizational skills
  • Teamwork

What are some common questions about Library Technicians?

Q: What’s the difference between a Library Technician and a Librarian?

A: While Library Technicians are more concerned with organizational and service oriented tasks, Librarians have more managerial and administrative tasks.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Library Technician.
